title: Marco Sturm’s faith in Marat Khusnutdinov gets rewarded with Bruins OT winner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marat Khusnutdinov scored the overtime winner, leading the Boston Bruins to a 4-3 victory over the Buffalo Sabres.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm elevated Khusnutdinov to the top line, pairing him with David Pastrnak against New York and Buffalo.
Elias Lindholm exited with an injury, prompting Sturm to play Khusnutdinov at center, contributing to Boston's strong performance.

title: Why Dan Orlovsky believes Drake Maye is NFL MVP frontrunner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye leads Patriots to a 6-2 record with strong performances, drawing MVP discussion from peers and analysts.
Dan Orlovsky regards Maye as the current NFL MVP frontrunner, highlighting his impact with limited team support.
Maye ranks third in NFL MVP odds behind Patrick Mahomes and Josh Allen, according to DraftKings betting lines.

title: Brookline farm starts free farmers market as Mass. residents brace for SNAP shutdown
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Allandale Farm in Brookline will host a free farmers market to support residents as the government shutdown affects SNAP benefits.
Open from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m., the market runs the first three Thursdays in November at Loring Greenough House.
Governor Maura Healey launched a new SNAP resource hub and doubled aid to food banks amid SNAP benefit disruptions.

title: $9,000 in donations stolen from Catholic church in Watertown, police say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: $9,000 in donations was stolen from St. Patrick's Church in Watertown after 5:30 p.m. on October 27.
The theft was discovered and reported to Watertown police at approximately 8:30 a.m. the next day.
Police have not identified any suspects; tips or video footage should be sent to Detective Joe Kelland.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm exits game with lower-body injury
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' Elias Lindholm suffered a lower-body injury during Thursday's game against the Buffalo Sabres.
Lindholm was hurt after colliding with Jordan Greenway and needed assistance to leave the ice.
Bruins head coach Marco Sturm confirmed Lindholm's injury without providing a specific timeline for his recovery.

title: David Ortiz offers up advice to Mookie Betts amid World Series slump
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Ortiz advised Mookie Betts to focus on having fun amid his World Series batting slump.
Betts is batting .130 in the World Series as the Dodgers face a 3-2 deficit against the Blue Jays.
Dodgers' top hitters struggled in Game 5 with a combined 1-for-15 performance against Toronto.

title: Irish firefighter found guilty of raping woman in Boston hotel, sentenced to 7-9 years in prison
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Terence Crosbie, an Irish firefighter, was found guilty of raping a woman in a Boston hotel and sentenced to 7-9 years.
The victim met Crosbie's colleague before the rape at a hotel where she had consensual sex with the colleague.
Crosbie plans to appeal, claiming the sentence is excessive and that the jury made a miscarriage of justice.

title: Brockton man allegedly in US illegally sentenced to prison for raping 14-year-old girl
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Erickson Barbosa, 32, from Cape Verde, sentenced to 7 years for raping a 14-year-old girl in 2020.
Barbosa also received a 5-year probation term and could face deportation after his prison sentence.
Barbosa fled to Florida in 2024 but was captured by U.S. Marshals and returned to Massachusetts.

title: ‘Special stuff’: Why Patriots CB Marcus Jones’s October was one to remember
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Marcus Jones was named AFC Defensive Player of the Month after an outstanding October with the New England Patriots.
Jones signed a three-year contract extension, continuing his tenure with the Patriots amid notable defensive and special teams performances.
Jones excelled with a key interception, 36 tackles, and a league-leading punt return game, including an 87-yard touchdown.

title: Dartmouth man pleads guilty to 2024 murder of New Bedford woman
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Tyler Baglini, 32, pleaded guilty to murdering 31-year-old Kerri Fidalgo in New Bedford, receiving a life sentence with parole possible in 25 years.
Baglini was found with a stained knife at St. Luke's Hospital after Fidalgo was discovered with stab wounds on Sept. 20, 2024.
Baglini has a history of violent offenses, including assaults, as noted by Judge Raffi N. Yessayan during the sentencing.
